definition: abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin
May you have a prosperous New Year! (New Year's greeting)
to have all one's wishes (idiom)/best wishes/all the best/may all your hopes be fulfilled
lit. (may the) five blessings descend upon this home (namely: longevity, wealth, health, virtue, and a natural death)/(an auspicious saying for the Lunar New Year)
to congratulate respectfully/to wish good luck and success (esp. to a superior)/with best wishes (in writing)
to pay a New Year call/to wish sb a Happy New Year
double happiness/the combined symmetric character 囍 (similar to 喜喜) as symbol of good luck, esp. marriage
long-lived people, rich harvests (idiom); stable and affluent society/prosperity
the dragon and phoenix are symbols of good fortune (idiom)/auspicious/decorated with auspicious symbols such as the dragon and the phoenix
May you have peace year after year (New Year's greeting)
to offer humbly (written at the end of letter from sb of lower status to higher status)/your humble servant
